result.execSummary:
The defendant Davon L Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 13CF1681 if revoked

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 13CF1681 if revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to live with grandparents and follow all house rules.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Davon L Price in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Davon L Price in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Attorney Delery - PH should have been on 10/23, not 10/22.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
